meanings.definition: To give or pass something to someone
meanings.sent1: She was handing out flyers to everyone in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys handing gifts to his friends on special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The magician was handing out invisible wands to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was handing knowledge to her students like a generous book dispenser.
meanings.sent5: The chef was handing out delicious samples of his new dish.

meanings.definition: To deliver or transfer something to someone else
meanings.sent1: The courier was handing the package to the customer at the door.
meanings.sent2: The postman was handing letters to each house on the street.
meanings.sent3: The robot was handing out batteries to the electronic devices.
meanings.sent4: The relay runner was handing the baton smoothly to the next teammate.
meanings.sent5: The nurse was handing out medications to the patients in the ward.

meanings.definition: To present or offer something to someone
meanings.sent1: The salesman was handing brochures to potential customers at the event.
meanings.sent2: The artist was handing his latest painting to the gallery owner for display.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was handing out jokes to the audience like candy.
meanings.sent4: The diplomat was handing peace treaties to the warring nations.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was handing freshly picked flowers to visitors at the botanical garden.
